hanzi-su-wiki:
胎

Значения

(Утроба) матери; беременность

Мнемоника

Послед, орган 月 роженицы, образовавшийся как следствие попадания в её влагалище 口 сперматозоидов 厶.

胎Новая плоть 肉,
вызывающая на теле женщины «возвышенность» 台.
tāiПлод, беременность
«Она держала в тайне свою беременность.»
Первая беременность (1-й тон).
purpleculture_pinyin:
tāi
fetus; classifier for litters (of puppies etc); padding (in clothing or bedding); womb carrying a fetus; (fig.) origin; source; (loanword) tire
плод; классификатор пометов (щенков и т. д.); набивка (в одежде или постельном белье); матка, несущая плод; (рис.) происхождение; источник; (заимствованное слово) шина

purpleculture_examples:
胚胎 [ pēi tāi ]: embryo
轮胎 [ lún tāi ]: tire; pneumatic tire
胎儿 [ tāi ér ]: unborn child; fetus; embryo
脱胎换骨 [ tuō tāi huàn gǔ ]: to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist; to turn over a new leaf; fig. to change wholly; to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
双胞胎 [ shuāng bāo tāi ]: twin; Classifiers: 对
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 台 [ tái ] platform; unit; term of address
heisig_chinese_memo: The body part feminists like to put on a platform (pedestal) is the womb, especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. "We carry a fetus and give birth, so it's your duty to do so-and-so".
heisig_constituent: womb, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, pedestal, elbow, mouth
koohiiStory1: The body part feminists like to put on a pedestal is the womb, especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. "We give birth, so it´s your duty to do so-and-so".
koohiiStory2: If any body part deserves to be put on a pedestal, it is the womb from which new life springs forth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The machine in your body that is powered by the moon is your womb, also called your uterus! Haven't you ever wondered why periods happen with the revolutions of the moon? That's because it powers your uterus and tells it what to do!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The next time you're cursing your uterus for making you bleed, curse the moon instead! It's the moon's fault you're in pain.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: It kind of sucks, but there is no way to sever this uterus - moon tie (たい). But if you find a way please tell me, I can't take this anymore.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture an invisible tie tieing your uterus to the moon. Damn you moon, stop pulling, it hurts!

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The body part feminists like to put on a platform (pedestal) is the womb, especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. "We carry a fetus and give birth, so it's your duty to do so-and-so".
humanum_full_description_en:
" fetus " starts with " flesh " and " tai " sound. The original meaning is a child in a human or animal mother. "Said Wen": "Fetus, pregnant women in three months. From the meat, Taiwan sound." "Book of Rites. Wang Zhi: "Do not kill the fetus." "Han Feizi. Yu Lao: "Leopard Fetus."

Bronze writing is used as a person's name.
humanum_full_description:
「胎」從「肉」，「台」聲，本義是人或動物母體裏的幼兒。《說文》：「胎，婦孕三月也。从肉，台聲。」《禮記．王制》：「不殺胎。」《韓非子．喻老》：「豹胎。」

　　金文用作人名。

「 胎 」從「 肉 」，「 台 」聲，本義是人或動物母體裏的幼兒。《說文》：「胎，婦孕三月也。从肉，台聲。」《禮記．王制》：「不殺胎。」《韓非子．喻老》：「豹胎。」 金文用作人名。
" fetus" starts with " flesh" and " tai" sound. The original meaning is a child in a human or animal mother. "Said Wen": "Fetus, pregnant women in three months. From the meat, Taiwan sound." "Book of Rites. Wang Zhi: "Do not kill the fetus." "Han Feizi. Yu Lao: "Leopard Fetus." Bronze writing is used as a person's name.

胎字的基本解释

胎
tāi
人或其他哺乳动物母体内的幼体：胎儿。胎生。胎教（ji刼 ）（指通过母体对胎儿施加影响，为胎儿发育提供良好的条件）。胚胎。怀胎。
事的开始，根源：祸胎。
器物的粗坯：泥胎。铜胎。
衬在衣服、被褥面子和里子之间的东西：棉花胎。

胎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tāi］
［《廣韻》土來切，平咍，透。］
亦作“囼1”。亦作“孡1”。
(1)人和哺乳动物孕于母体内的幼体。
(2)喻指如孕于母体者。
(3)孕育；肇始。
(4)养。
(5)事物的根源或初基。
(6)衬在衣服、被褥等的面子和里子之间的东西。
(7)器物的坯子。
(8)犹先天；生来。
(9)怀孕或生育的次数。
(10)谓隆起如伏卧之状。
(11)［英tyre］轮胎

胎字的英文翻译

◎ 胎
embryo, fetus, padding, tyre

胎字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　胎； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页978第02
【唐韻】土來切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】湯來切，?音台。【說文】婦孕三月也。从肉，台，意兼聲。【廣韻】始也。【增韻】凡孕而未生，皆曰胎。【爾雅·釋詁】胎，始也。【註】胚胎未成，亦物之始也。【博雅】人三月而胎。【史記·律書】營室者，主營胎。　又獸亦謂之胎。【禮·王制】不殺胎。【史記·樂書】胎生者不殰。【註】胎生，獸也。　又珠亦謂之胎。【前漢·揚雄傳】剖明月之珠胎。【註】珠在蛤中，若懷姙然，故謂之胎也。　又逃也。【揚子·方言】胎，逃也。【註】謂逃叛也。　又【韻補】叶音怡。【漢樂章】衆庶熙熙，施及夭胎。羣生啿啿，受春之祺。【徐幹·七喻】大宛之犧，三江之鮭。雲鶬水鵠，熊蹯豹胎。　又叶音駝。【道藏謌】乞免五難中，制召諸天魔。靈嶽不崩陷，福地更鍊胎。　【集韻】或作孡。

胎字的源字形

胎字的起名意思

未生的幼体，胚胎。母体内的幼体。

fetal
Basic explanation of words
fetal
tāi
Juveniles in the mothers of humans or other mammals: fetuses. viviparous. Prenatal education (ji 刼) (refers to exerting influence on the fetus through the mother's body to provide good conditions for the development of the fetus). Embryo. Pregnant.
The beginning of the matter, the root cause: misfortune.
Rough artifacts: mud tires. Copper tires.
The thing lining between the face and lining of clothes, bedding: cotton tires.
fetal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tāi］
["Guangyun" cut from soil, flat and thorough. ]
Also known as "囼1". Also known as "孡1".
(1) The larvae of humans and mammals conceived in the mother's body.
(2) The metaphor refers to those who are pregnant in the mother's body.
(3) Inoculation; the beginning.
(4) Raise.
(5) The root or initial foundation of things.
(6) Things that line the face and lining of clothes, bedding, etc.
(7) The blank of the utensil.
(8) You are born; born.
(9) The number of pregnancy or childbirth.
(10) It is said that the uplift is like lying down.
(11) [British tyre] tires
fetal

[Tang Yun] Cut from the soil [Ji Yun] [Rhyme] [Zheng Yun] Cut the soup with the sound table. 【Said the text】Women are pregnant in three months. From the meat, the station, the meaning and the sound. [Guang Yun] Beginning. [Zengyun] Everyone who is pregnant but has not given birth is called a fetus. 【Erya·Shigu】The fetus is the beginning. [Note] The embryo is not formed, it is also the beginning of things. [Bo Ya] People give birth in March. 【Historical Records·Law Book】The campers mainly deal with tires.　The beast is also called the fetus. 【Rite · King System】Do not kill the fetus. 【Historical Records·Book of Music】The viviparous person does not die. [Note] Viviparous, animal also.　Youzhu is also called the fetus. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong Biography] Anatomy of the beaded baby of the moon. [Note] If the beads are in the clam, if the pregnant woman is pregnant, it is called the fetus.　Escape again. 【Yangtze Dialect】Flee from birth. [Note] It is also called escaping.　[Rhyme Filling] Ye Yinyi. [Han Music] The public concubine Xixi, Shi Ji gave birth. Crowd of students wailing, welcome to spring. 1) зародыш, плод; эмбрион; плацента

Radicals: 月, 台  (moon, machine)
Meaning Mnemonic
The machine in your body that is powered by the moon is your womb, also called your uterus! Haven't you ever wondered why periods happen with the revolutions of the moon? That's because it powers your uterus and tells it what to do!
The next time you're cursing your uterus for making you bleed, curse the moon instead! It's the moon's fault you're in pain.
Reading Mnemonic
It kind of sucks, but there is no way to sever this uterus - moon tie (たい). But if you find a way please tell me, I can't take this anymore.
Picture an invisible tie tieing your uterus to the moon. Damn you moon, stop pulling, it hurts!
